com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.acl

Class AclEntry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.acl.AclEntry

  • public class AclEntry
extends Object
    Contains one ACL entry. An ACL entry consists of a scope (access or default), the type of the ACL (user, group, other or mask), the name of the user or group associated with this ACL (can be blank to specify the default permissions for users and groups, and must be blank for mask entries), and the action permitted by this ACL entry.

    An ACL for an object consists of a List of Acl entries.

    This class also provides a number of convenience methods for converting ACL entries and ACLs to and back from strings.

    • Field Detail

      • scope

        public AclScope scope
        AclScope specifying scope of the Acl entry (access or default)

      • type

        public AclType type
        AclType specifying the type of the Acl entry (user, group, other or mask)

      • name

        public String name
        String specifying the name of the user or group associated with this Acl entry. Can be blank to specify the default permissions for users and groups, and must be blank for mask entries.

      • action

        public AclAction action
        AclAction enum specifying the action permitted by this Acl entry. Has convenience methods to create value from unix-style permission string (e.g., AclAction.fromRwx("rw-")), or from unix Octal permission (e.g., AclAction.fromOctal(6)).

    • Method Detail

      • parseAclEntry

        public static AclEntry parseAclEntry(String entryString)
                              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Parses an Acl entry from its posix string form. For example: "default:user:bob:r-x"
        Parameters:
        entryString - Acl entry string to parse
        Returns:
        AclEntry parsed from the string
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the string is invalid

      • parseAclEntry

        public static AclEntry parseAclEntry(String entryString,
                                     boolean removeAcl)
                              throws IllegalArgumentException
        Parses a single Acl entry from its posix string form. For example: "default:user:bob:r-x".

        If the Acl string will be used to remove an existing acl from a file or folder, then the permission level does not need to be specified. Passing false to the removeAcl argument tells the parser to accept such strings.

        Parameters:
        entryString - Acl entry string to parse
        removeAcl - boolean specifying whether to parse this string like a remove Acl (that is, with permission optional)
        Returns:
        AclEntry parsed from the string
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the string is invalid

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the posix string form of this acl entry. For example: "default:user:bob:r-x".
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        the posix string form of this acl entry

      • toString

        public String toString(boolean removeAcl)
        Returns the posix string form of this acl entry. For example: "default:user:bob:r-x".

        If the Acl string will be used to remove an existing acl from a file or folder, then the permission level does not need to be specified. Passing true to the removeAcl argument omits the permission level in the output string.

        Parameters:
        removeAcl - passing true will result in an acl entry string with no permission specified
        Returns:
        the string form of the AclEntry

      • parseAclSpec

        public static List<AclEntry> parseAclSpec(String aclString)
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        parses a posix acl spec string into a List of AclEntrys.
        Parameters:
        aclString - the acl spec string tp parse
        Returns:
        List<AclEntry> represented by the acl spec string
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • aclListToString

        public static String aclListToString(List<AclEntry> list)
        converts a List<AclEntry> to its posix aclspec string form
        Parameters:
        list - List<AclEntry> to covert to string
        Returns:
        posix acl spec string

      • aclListToString

        public static String aclListToString(List<AclEntry> list,
                                     boolean removeAcl)
        converts a List<AclEntry> to its posix aclspec string form.

        If the aclspec string will be used to remove an existing acl from a file or folder, then the permission level does not need to be specified. Passing true to the removeAcl argument omits the permission level in the output string.

        Parameters:
        list - List<AclEntry> to covert to string
        removeAcl - removeAcl passing true will result in an aclspec with no permission specified
        Returns:
        posix acl spec string
